starvationevasion.sim

Class Simulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • starvationevasion.sim.Simulator

  • public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main API point of the Starvation Evasion Simulator. This constructor should be called once at the start of each game by the Server.

      static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
      This entry point is for testing only.
      WorldData nextTurn(java.util.ArrayList<PolicyCard> cards)
      The Server should call nextTurn(cards) when it is ready to advance the simulator a turn (Constant.YEARS_PER_TURN years).

      Before calling nextTurn, the Server must: Verify all policy cards drafted by the clients during the draft phase. Verify that any cards discarded by a player could be discarded. Call discard on each card discarded by a player. End the voting phase and decide the results. Call discard on each card that did not receive enough votes. Call drawCards for each player and send them their new cards.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Simulator

        public Simulator(int startYear)
        This constructor should be called once at the start of each game by the Server. Initializes the model Generates a random 80 card deck for each player (both human and AI players)
        Parameters:
        startYear - year the game is starting. Generally this will be Constant.FIRST_YEAR.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public WorldData init()
        The Server should call init() at the start of the game before dealing cards to players.
        Returns:
        data structure populated with all game state data needed by the client except high resolution data that might be needed by the visualizer.

      • nextTurn

        public WorldData nextTurn(java.util.ArrayList<PolicyCard> cards)
        The Server should call nextTurn(cards) when it is ready to advance the simulator a turn (Constant.YEARS_PER_TURN years).

        Before calling nextTurn, the Server must:
        1. Verify all policy cards drafted by the clients during the draft phase.
        2. Verify that any cards discarded by a player could be discarded.
        3. Call discard on each card discarded by a player.
        4. End the voting phase and decide the results.
        5. Call discard on each card that did not receive enough votes.
        6. Call drawCards for each player and send them their new cards.
        Parameters:
        cards - List of PolicyCards enacted this turn. Note: cards played but not enacted (did not get required votes) must NOT be in this list. Such cards must be discarded (call discard(EnumRegion playerRegion, PolicyCard card)) before calling this method.
        Returns:
        data structure populated with all game state data needed by the client except high resolution data that might be needed by the visualizer.

      • drawCards

        public EnumPolicy[] drawCards(EnumRegion playerRegion)
        The server must call this for each playerRegion before the first turn and during each turn's draw phase. This method will return the proper number of cards from the top of the given playerRegion's deck taking into account cards played and discarded by that player.
        Parameters:
        playerRegion - region of player who id given the drawn cards.
        Returns:
        collection of cards.

      • discard

        public void discard(EnumRegion playerRegion,
                    EnumPolicy card)
        The Server must call this for each card that is discarded before calling nextTurn(). There are three different ways a card may be discarded:
        1. During the draft phase, a player may use an action to discard up to 3 policy cards and immediately draw that many new cards. Using an action means the player can draft one less policy that turn. What is meant by immediately is that a player who does this and who still has a remaining action, may draft one of the newly drawn cards during that same draft phase.
        2. As part of each draft phase, each player may discard a single policy card. Cards discarded this way are not replaced until the draw phase (after the voting phase).
        3. A policy that is drafted, bt does not receive the required votes is discarded.
        Parameters:
        playerRegion - player who owns the discarded card.
        card - to be discarded.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This entry point is for testing only.

        This test shows how to instantiate the simulator and how to tell it to deal each player a hand of cards.
        Parameters:
        args - ignored.
